summary:
Mr. Olympia is a yearly bodybuilding competition for men, part of the Olympia Fitness Weekend. It was started by Joe Weider in 1965 to give amateur bodybuilders a chance to keep competing and earn money. The first winner was Larry Scott. The record for most wins is held by Lee Haney and Ronnie Coleman, with eight each.

There are other divisions for men and women, like the 212 division, Men's Physique, Classic Physique, Ms. Olympia, Fitness Olympia, and Figure Olympia. The event also inspired the movie "Pumping Iron" in 1977, which launched the acting careers of Arnold Schwarzenegger and others.
title: Mr. Olympia
